decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, the recommendations contained within section 8.3 and 9.2.1 within the Ecological Appraisal prepared by Deepdene Ecology dated July 2024  shall be implemented in full and permanently retained thereafter. The applicant shall install at least one integrated  bat box within the  wall of the new built sections  of the building (to be installed away from windows and artificial light source). In respect of external lighting within the development, this must be kept to a minimum and follow the guidance from the Bat Conservation Trust 'Bats and artifical lighting at Night ' (2023). Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The works shall be carried out and maintained in accordance with the deposited Fire Statement compliant with Policy D12(A).Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.
description: Erection of first floor side extension with pitched/crown roof extension to create additional accommodation in the roof-space. Raising of roof height of existing side extension.
